edu.umass.cs.gigapaxos

Enum PaxosConfig.PC

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<PaxosConfig.PC>
      • edu.umass.cs.gigapaxos.PaxosConfig.PC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.umass.cs.utils.Config.ConfigurableEnum, edu.umass.cs.utils.Config.DefaultValueEnum, edu.umass.cs.utils.Config.Disableable, Serializable, Comparable<PaxosConfig.PC>
    Enclosing class:
    PaxosConfig

    public static enum PaxosConfig.PC
extends Enum<PaxosConfig.PC>
implements edu.umass.cs.utils.Config.ConfigurableEnum, edu.umass.cs.utils.Config.Disableable
    All gigapaxos config parameters that can be specified via a configuration file.

      If true, identical requests, i.e., requests with the same requestID, paxosID, and sending client's socket address, will get a recently cached response if any instead of re-coordinating the request.

      FLUSH_FCLOSE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC APPLICATION
        Default application managed by gigapaxos.

      • CLIENT_PORT_OFFSET

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC CLIENT_PORT_OFFSET
        Default offset for the client facing port.

      • CLIENT_PORT_SSL_OFFSET

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC CLIENT_PORT_SSL_OFFSET
        Default offset for the client facing ssl port.

      • DEBUG

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DEBUG
        Verbose debugging and request instrumentation

      • DISABLE_LOGGING

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DISABLE_LOGGING
        True means no persistent logging

      • ENABLE_JOURNALING

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC ENABLE_JOURNALING
        FIXME: Journaling based log for efficiency. Needs periodic compaction that is not yet implemented, so this log exists only for performance instrumentation.

      • DISABLE_CHECKPOINTING

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DISABLE_CHECKPOINTING
        True means no checkpointing. If logging is enabled (as is the default), the logs will grow unbounded. So either both should be true or both should be false.

      • ENABLE_COMPRESSION

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC ENABLE_COMPRESSION

      • COMPRESSION_THRESHOLD

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC COMPRESSION_THRESHOLD

      • PINSTANCES_CAPACITY

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC PINSTANCES_CAPACITY
        The default size of the MultiArrayMap used to store paxos instances.

      • MORGUE_DELAY

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC MORGUE_DELAY
        The waiting period for paxos instance corpses in order to prevent inadvertant rebirths because of the missed birthing paxos instance creation mechanism.

      • HIBERNATE_OPTION

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC HIBERNATE_OPTION
        Whether the hibernate option is enabled.

      • PAUSE_OPTION

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC PAUSE_OPTION
        Whether the pause option is enabled.

      • PAUSE_SIZE_THRESHOLD

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC PAUSE_SIZE_THRESHOLD
        Fraction of capacity to be reached in order for pausing to get enabled.

      • DEACTIVATION_PERIOD

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DEACTIVATION_PERIOD
        The time after which the deactivation thread will attempt to pause idle paxos instances by making a pass over all currently unpaused instances. This is also the period for which a paxos instance must be idle in order to be paused.

      • PAUSE_RATE_LIMIT

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC PAUSE_RATE_LIMIT
        Limits the rate of pausing to not interfere with request processing. But it has the downside of increasing the total pause time as well as limiting the paxos instance creation rate. For example, pausing a million instances will take 1000s with the default rate limit of 1000/s.

      • MAX_FINAL_STATE_AGE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC MAX_FINAL_STATE_AGE
        Refer to documentation in SQLPaxosLogger.

      • BATCHING_ENABLED

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC BATCHING_ENABLED
        Whether request batching is enabled.

      • MAX_LOG_FILE_SIZE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC MAX_LOG_FILE_SIZE

      • CAN_CREATE_TIMEOUT

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC CAN_CREATE_TIMEOUT
        Wait period for forcibly killing a lower paxos instance version in order to start a higher version.

        FIXME: Unclear what a good default is for good liveness. It doesn't really matter for safety of reconfiguration.

      • WAIT_TO_GET_CREATED_TIMEOUT

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC WAIT_TO_GET_CREATED_TIMEOUT
        Wait period before going forth with a missed birthing paxos instance creation to see if the instance gets normally created anyway.

      • MAX_LOG_MESSAGE_SIZE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC MAX_LOG_MESSAGE_SIZE
        The maximum log message size. The higher the batching, the higher this value needs to be.

      • MAX_CHECKPOINT_SIZE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC MAX_CHECKPOINT_SIZE
        The maximum checkpoint size. The default below is the maximum size of varchar in embedded derby, which is probably somewhat faster than clobs, which would be automatically used with bigger checkpoint sizes.

      • LOG_GC_FREQUENCY

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC LOG_GC_FREQUENCY
        Number of checkpoints after which log messages will be garbage collected for a paxos group. We really don't need to do garbage collection at all until the size of the table starts affecting log message retrieval time or the size of the table starts causing the indexing overhead to become high at insertion time; the latter is unlikely as we maintain an index on the paxosID key.

      • JOURNAL_GC_FREQUENCY

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC JOURNAL_GC_FREQUENCY
        Number of log files after which GC will be attempted.

      • COMPACTION_FREQUENCY

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC COMPACTION_FREQUENCY
        Number of log files after which compaction will be attempted.

      • LOG_INDEX_FREQUENCY

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC LOG_INDEX_FREQUENCY
        The number of log messages after which they are indexed into the DB. Indexing every log message doubles the logging overhead and doesn't have to be done (unless #SYNC_INDEX_JOURNAL is enabled). Upon recovery however, we need to do slightly more work to ensure that all uncommitted log messages are indexed into the DB.

      • INDEX_LOG_TABLE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC INDEX_LOG_TABLE
        Whether fields in the log messages table in the DB should be indexed. This index refers to the DB's internal index as opposed to DB_INDEX_JOURNAL that is an explicit index of log messages journaled on the file system.

      • BATCH_SLEEP_DURATION

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC BATCH_SLEEP_DURATION
        A tiny amount of minimum sleep imposed on every request in order to improve batching benefits. Also refer to BATCH_OVERHEAD.

      • BATCH_OVERHEAD

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC BATCH_OVERHEAD
        Inverse of the percentage overhead of agreement latency added to the sleep duration used for increasing batching gains. Also refer to .

      • DISABLE_SYNC_DECISIONS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DISABLE_SYNC_DECISIONS

      • MAX_BATCH_SIZE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC MAX_BATCH_SIZE
        Maximum number of batched requests. Setting it to infinity means that the log message size will still limit it.

      • CHECKPOINT_INTERVAL

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC CHECKPOINT_INTERVAL
        Checkpoint interval. A larger value means slower recovery, slower coordinator changes, and less frequent garbage collection, but it also means less frequent IO or higher request throughput.

      • PACKET_DEMULTIPLEXER_THREADS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC PACKET_DEMULTIPLEXER_THREADS
        Number of threads in packet demultiplexer. More than 0 means that we may not preserve the order of client requests while processing them.

      • ORDER_PRESERVING_REQUESTS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC ORDER_PRESERVING_REQUESTS
        Whether request order is preserved for requests sent by the same replica and committed by the same coordinator.

      • EMULATE_UNREPLICATED

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC EMULATE_UNREPLICATED
        The replica receiving the request will simply send the request to the local application replica, i.e., this essentially disables all paxos coordination. This is used only for testing.

      • NO_RESPONSE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC NO_RESPONSE
        If true, the servers will send no response. For testing only.

      • EXECUTE_UPON_ACCEPT

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC EXECUTE_UPON_ACCEPT
        Only for performance instrumentation. If true, replicas will simply execute the request upon receiving an ACCEPT. This option will break RSM safety.

      • LAZY_PROPAGATION

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC LAZY_PROPAGATION
        Also used for testing. Lazily propagates requests to other replicas when emulating unreplicated execution mode.

      • BATCHED_ACCEPT_REPLIES

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC BATCHED_ACCEPT_REPLIES
        Enables coalescing of accept replies.

      • BATCHED_COMMITS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC BATCHED_COMMITS
        Enables coalescing of commits. For coalesced commits, a replica must have the corresponding accept logged, otherwise it will end up sync'ing and increasing overhead. Enabling this option but not persistent logging can cause liveness problems.

      • DB_COMPRESSION

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DB_COMPRESSION
        Whether to store compressed logs in the DB.

      • ENABLE_INSTRUMENTATION

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC ENABLE_INSTRUMENTATION
        Instrumentation at various places. Should be enabled only during testing and disabled during production use.

      • ENABLE_STATIC_CHECKS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC ENABLE_STATIC_CHECKS

      • DELAY_PROFILER

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DELAY_PROFILER
        Whether DelayProfiler should be enabled.

      • JSON_LIBRARY

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC JSON_LIBRARY

      • GIGAPAXOS_DATA_DIR

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC GIGAPAXOS_DATA_DIR
        The top-level directory inside which all gigapaxos-related data is stored. Paxos logs and checkpoints are stored in the sub-directory PAXOS_LOGS_DIR. Reconfiguration logs are stored in the sub-directory RECONFIGURATION_DB_DIR.

      • PAXOS_LOGS_DIR

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC PAXOS_LOGS_DIR
        Location for paxos logs when an embedded DB is used. This can not be changed.

      • PAXOS_DB_PREFIX

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC PAXOS_DB_PREFIX
        Prefix of the paxos DB's name. The whole name is obtained by concatenating this prefix with the node ID. In the embedded DB case, paxos logs for "nodeID" are stored at GIGAPAXOS_DATA_DIR/PAXOS_LOGS_DIR/PAXOS_DB_PREFIX"nodeID".

      • MAX_PAXOS_ID_SIZE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC MAX_PAXOS_ID_SIZE
        Maximum length in characters of a paxos group name.

      • SQL_TYPE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC SQL_TYPE
        SQL.SQLType type. Currently, the only other alternative is "MYSQL". Refer the above class to specify the user name and password.

      • MAX_GROUP_SIZE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC MAX_GROUP_SIZE
        Maximum size of a paxos replica group.

      • MAX_OUTSTANDING_REQUESTS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC MAX_OUTSTANDING_REQUESTS
        Threshold for throttling client request load.

      • THROTTLE_SLEEP

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC THROTTLE_SLEEP
        Sleep millis to throttle client requests if overloaded. Used only for testing.

      • CLIENT_SSL_MODE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC CLIENT_SSL_MODE
        Client-server SSL mode.

      • SERVER_SSL_MODE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC SERVER_SSL_MODE
        Server-server SSL mode.

      • NUM_MESSENGER_WORKERS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC NUM_MESSENGER_WORKERS
        Number of additional sending connections used by paxos. We need this because the sending throughput of a single TCP connection is limited and can become a bottleneck at the coordinator.

      • USE_NIO_SENDER_TASK

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC USE_NIO_SENDER_TASK

      • DISABLE_CC

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DISABLE_CC
        Disable congestion pushback.

      • USE_GC_MAP

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC USE_GC_MAP
        If true, we use a garbage collected map that has higher overhead than a regular map, but is still not a bottleneck.

      • LOG_META_DECISIONS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC LOG_META_DECISIONS
        Only log meta decisions if corresponding accept was previously received.

      • BYTEIFICATION

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC BYTEIFICATION
        Whether select packets should be byteified as opposed to json-stringified.

      • INSTRUMENT_SERIALIZATION

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC INSTRUMENT_SERIALIZATION

      • STRICT_ADDRESS_CHECKS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC STRICT_ADDRESS_CHECKS

      • CLIENT_DEMULTIPLEXER_THREADS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC CLIENT_DEMULTIPLEXER_THREADS

      • READ_YOUR_WRITES

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC READ_YOUR_WRITES
        Disables the feature that redirects requests to the most recent replica from which a response to a coordinated request, i.e., a ReplicableRequest with ReplicableRequest.needsCoordination() true, was received. Note that enabling this feature means that latency-based request redirection at the client will not happen, so the client may be sending requests to far away active replicas even though nearer ones exist. This is because latency-based redirection works by probing, i.e., a small fraction, E2ELatencyAwareRedirector.PROBE_RATIO of requests are sent to a random active replica, in order to enable nearest-server redirection.

      • PREVENT_DOUBLE_EXECUTION

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC PREVENT_DOUBLE_EXECUTION
        If true, gigapaxos will try to prevent executing (retransmitted) requests if they had already been executed in the recent past. In such cases, the response from the first execution will be returned to the app. This method can not be relied upon for safety as gigapaxos will cache executed requests for a limited time and is space-contrained.

      • PAUSABLE_INDEX_JOURNAL

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC PAUSABLE_INDEX_JOURNAL
        Whether journal entries should be synchronously indexed in the DB. Makes journaling (and overall throughput) slower but makes safe retrieval of logged messages easier both during normal operations and upon recovery. During normal operations, we just have to check the DB and also check the pending log in memory to ensure that we don't miss any log messages. Upon recovery however, there is no pending log in memory and the system may have crashed with some pending log messages before they could be inserted into the DB, so we just have to find the last message logged in the DB and put the rest in a pending queue for logging into the DB.

      • MULTITHREAD_LOGGER

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC MULTITHREAD_LOGGER
        Whether more than one thread is used to log messages.

      • DB_INDEX_JOURNAL

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DB_INDEX_JOURNAL
        True means that the journal entries will be indexed in the DB. False (default) means we maintain an in-memory index while infrequently pausing unused entries to disk (using DiskMap while reconstructing unsaved entries upon recovery using the written-ahead journal log files.

      • FAILURE_DETECTION_TIMEOUT

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC FAILURE_DETECTION_TIMEOUT
        Failure detection timeout in seconds after which a node will be considered dead if no keepalives have been received from it. Used to detect coordinator failures.

      • REQUEST_TIMEOUT

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC REQUEST_TIMEOUT
        Request timeout in seconds after which the request will be deleted from the outstanding queue. Currently, there is no effort to remove any other state for that request from the system.

      • USE_MAP_DB

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC USE_MAP_DB
        Whether the mapdb package should be used. It seems too slow for our purposes, so we use our own custom write-ahead logger.

      • USE_CHECKPOINTS_AS_PAUSE_TABLE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC USE_CHECKPOINTS_AS_PAUSE_TABLE
        If true, the checkpoints table will be used to also store paused state as opposed to storing paused state in its own table. The reason to store paused state in the same table as checkpoints is that we can easily compute FIXME:

      • USE_DISK_MAP

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC USE_DISK_MAP

      • USE_HEX_TIMESTAMP

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC USE_HEX_TIMESTAMP

      • LAZY_COMPACTION

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC LAZY_COMPACTION

      • PAUSE_BATCH_SIZE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC PAUSE_BATCH_SIZE

      • SYNC

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC SYNC

      • FLUSH

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC FLUSH

      • SYNC_FCLOSE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC SYNC_FCLOSE

      • FLUSH_FCLOSE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC FLUSH_FCLOSE

      • LOGFILE_AGE_THRESHOLD

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC LOGFILE_AGE_THRESHOLD
        Minimum seconds after last modification when a compaction attempt can be made.

      • CPI_NOISE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC CPI_NOISE
        Percentage variation around mean in checkpoint interval.

      • BATCH_CHECKPOINTS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC BATCH_CHECKPOINTS
        Whether checkpoints should be batched. We rely on the fact that synchronous checkpointing is not necessary for safety except for the initial state and the state after the stop request. We just need to ensure that the state for the checkpoint is synchronously obtained from the application immediately after the corresponding request execution.

      • MAX_DB_BATCH_SIZE

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC MAX_DB_BATCH_SIZE

      • HANDLE_REQUEST_RETRY_INTERVAL

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC HANDLE_REQUEST_RETRY_INTERVAL
        Number of milliseconds after which Application.execute(edu.umass.cs.gigapaxos.interfaces.Request) will be re-attempted until it returns true.

      • HANDLE_REQUEST_RETRY_LIMIT

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC HANDLE_REQUEST_RETRY_LIMIT
        Maximum number of retry attempts for Application.execute(edu.umass.cs.gigapaxos.interfaces.Request) . After these many unsuccessful attempts, the paxos instance will be killed.

      • DIGEST_REQUESTS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DIGEST_REQUESTS
        Broadcast requests at entry replica and use digests in accepts. This makes a noticeable difference only when the number of groups is small (like 1 or 2). For more groups, the reordering effects seem to hurt more than help. Disabled by default.

      • DIGEST_THRESHOLD

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DIGEST_THRESHOLD
        Number of active groups up to which digesting is done. Digests seem to hurt with many groups probably because the cost more than offsets the benefit. With many groups, the coordinator load balancing benefit of digests is negligible. The main benefit is that they save one transmission of the request body, but they increase the total number of messages by one and lose out on stringification optimizations at acceptors. Furthermore, a digested accept is useless unless the corresponding request body arrives, which seems to slow down the overall throughput of the system.

      • BATCH_ACROSS_GROUPS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC BATCH_ACROSS_GROUPS
        Whether paxos packets across different paxos groups should be batched if they are going to the same set of destinations.

      • FLIP_BATCHED_ACCEPTS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC FLIP_BATCHED_ACCEPTS
        Whether accept batching should be different from BATCH_ACROSS_GROUPS. True means that we won't batch accepts even if BATCH_ACROSS_GROUPS is true. Accept batching doesn't really help unless DIGEST_REQUESTS is enabled and that is by default enabled only if the number of active instances is small.

      • BATCHED_REQUESTS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC BATCHED_REQUESTS
        Whether RequestPacket and inherited classes should be batched. This batching is different from the batching in BATCHING_ENABLED. It refers to batching of entire packets to marginally reduce network overhead. It really makes little difference either way. With the new byteification methods and batching opportunities (as in BATCHING_ENABLED), this option actually has a small net cost, so it should be disabled by default. It may give small benefits with a large number of groups and little room for batching within each group.

      • SHORT_CIRCUIT_LOCAL

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC SHORT_CIRCUIT_LOCAL
        Local messages are not put in PaxosPacketBatcher.

      • NUM_MESSAGE_DIGESTS

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC NUM_MESSAGE_DIGESTS

      • DEBUG_MONITOR

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DEBUG_MONITOR

      • ACCEPT_TIMEOUT

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC ACCEPT_TIMEOUT

      • POKE_COORDINATOR

      • MIN_PP_BATCH_SIZE

        Minimum number of packets in order to consider PaxosPacket batching.

      • LOG_DISKMAP_CAPACITY

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC LOG_DISKMAP_CAPACITY

      • DIGEST_THRESHOLD_SIZE

      • BLOCKING_CHECKPOINT

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC BLOCKING_CHECKPOINT

      • GC_MAJORITY_EXECUTED

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC GC_MAJORITY_EXECUTED
        True means we garbage collect accepts up to the slot that a majority have executed; otherwise up to the slot that a majority have checkpointed.

      • DISABLE_GET_LOGGED_MESSAGES

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC DISABLE_GET_LOGGED_MESSAGES
        Testing option. Implies no coordinator fault-tolerance.

      • ENABLE_RESPONSE_CACHING

        public static final PaxosConfig.PC ENABLE_RESPONSE_CACHING
        If true, identical requests, i.e., requests with the same requestID, paxosID, and sending client's socket address, will get a recently cached response if any instead of re-coordinating the request. This is useful to reduce the likelihood of double-execution, but does not eliminate it completely.
